tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (exempt to second reshuffle)
tourBios.curYearHigh: Played in 20 events on the Web.com Tour, made 11 cuts with best finish a T5 at the Chile Classic
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Finished T103 at Web.com Tour Q-School in December...Had a consistent PGA TOUR China season, a year that included one victory and five additional top-10s. Ended the season third on the Order of Merit to earn 2015 Web.com Tour membership. Had an up-and-down week at the PGA TOUR China Series' second qualifying tournament. Enjoyed a tournament-best, 8-under 64 in the first round at the Sandbelt Trails Course at Mission Hills GC. Stumbled to a 5-over 77 on the second day then played even-par golf over the final 36 holes (71-73) to T4 with J.H. Wang, six shots behind medalist Alex Hawley…Opened 68-70 then was 4-over on the weekend to finish 3-under overall at the Buick Open to T13 with Ray Beaufils and Chris Campbell…Appeared destined to a runner-up finish at the United Investment Real Estate Wuhan Open, trailing playing partner Xin Jun Zhang by a stroke playing the final hole Sunday. He made it into a playoff when Zhang bogeyed the 72nd hole, joining Hao Tong Li in the three-man extra session. After the trio parred the first playoff hole, he rolled in a birdie putt that Zhang and Li couldn't match, giving him his first professional title. Shot rounds of 73-70-67-70, his final round bogey-free, as he became the first Australian to win on the PGA TOUR China Series…After winning his first event, backed up that performance with a T10 at the Lanhai Open outside Shanghai, firing a final-round, 3-under 69 to tie with Shih Chang Chan, Mathew Perry, Fei Hao Yang and Wei Huang Wu…Was T15 in his next start, at the Earls Beijing Open. Added his fifth consecutive top-15 finish when he T13 at the Yulongwan Yunnan Open in August. Opened with an even-par 72 at Yulongwan GC then fired rounds of 67-69-68 (12-under) over his final 54 holes…Earned his fifth consecutive top-15 showing with a T13 at the Yulongwan Yunnan Open in early August. Had four par-or-better rounds, including a 67-69-68 performance over his final 54 holes…Had a nice showing on the PGA Tour of Australasia in mid-August. Opened 73-74 at the Isuzu Queensland Open then recovered with rounds of 68-71 (5-under) at Brookwater G&CC in Brisbane to T8 with amateur Kade McBride, five shots behind winner Andrew Dodt…Had another solid chance at victory at the Cadillac Championship in mid-September after a tournament-low, third-round 64. Began the final round in Beijing tied with Bryden Macpherson, two shots behind fellow Australian David McKenzie. Started his Sunday round with eight consecutive pars at Qinghe Bay GC before making birdie on the ninth hole. Appeared ready to make a run when he added another birdie at No. 11. But bogeys on Nos. 14 and 16 and a double bogey at the 17th hole ended any hopes of earning his second title of the campaign. Finished T5…Ended a distant 11 shots behind winner Li but still enjoyed a top-five finish with his T4 effort at the Jianye Tianzhu Henan Open. Jumped into contention with a second-round, 7-under 65 at St. Andrews Zhengzhou GC before a 4-over weekend ended any hopes of winning for a second time…Posted his third consecutive top-10—and his fifth overall—when he T8 at the Nine Dragons Open in November. Final-round 70 left him tied with MacPherson. Held a share of the 36-hole lead at the Hainan Open with Li in late-November. A weekend battle never ensued as he shot a 3-over 75 Saturday to trail Li by six shots with 18 holes to play. Came back with a 2-under 70 on the final day to T2 with South Korea's Dohyun Kim, six strokes behind Li's winning pace.

2013: Turned professional midway through the season and counted back-to-back top-10s on the PGA Tour of Australasia in October as his best performances. He T10 at the WA Golfields PGA Championship then came back with a T7 at the Western Australia Open. Finished No. 100 on that circuit's Order of Merit.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Made it to match play of the 2013 British Amateur by shooting rounds of 72-70 at Royal Cinque's Ports and Prince's Courses in England. Defeated Denmark's Niklas Moeller, 3 and 2, in the first round before falling to Denmark's Kasper Estrup in 20 holes…Finished 24th at the 2013 Victorian Open, shooting a final-round 67…Played in the 2012 Asia-Pacific Amateur and finished seventh. Opened with three consecutive 71s and then added a 69…Was fourth at the Sahalee Players Championship in the United States, with a strong weekend (68-69) giving him the top-5 finish.
tourBios.personal: Enjoys watching cricket…Admires players like Adam Scott and Ian Poulter...Loves James Bond movies... Would like to be featured in Forbes magazine one day... Most famous person he met is professional cricket player Michael Clarke...If he weren't playing professional golf, he would be playing cricket...Favorite TV show is "The Big Bang Theory."...Best sporting event attended was Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals between the Chicago Blackhawks and the Detroit Red Wings...Favorite place to visit is Chicago...Dream foursome would include Jack Nicklaus, Rory McIlroy and Adam Scott...Twitter name is @specs59.

tourBios.curYrHigh: Played in 20 events on the Web.com Tour, made 11 cuts with best finish a T5 at the Chile Classic
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Played in 20 Web.com Tour events, making 11 cuts. Finished 93rd on the money list...In first outing, had top-10, firing 66-64 to share the 36-hole lead with Wes Roach and Dawie van der Walt at the Chile Classic in March. A solid weekend of 69-68, highlighted by a closing-hole eagle on Sunday, resulted in a T5 finish...Withdrew prior to the start of the Chitimacha Louisiana Open with a sore neck...Best finish other than Chile was a T22 at Cartagena de Indias Karibana Championship, which came two weeks earlier.

Came back with a 2-under 70 on the final day to T2 with South Korea's Dohyun Kim, six strokes behind Li's winning pace.

2013: Turned professional midway through the season and counted back-to-back top-10s on the PGA Tour of Australasia in October as his best performances. He T10 at the WA Golfields PGA Championship then came back with a T7 at the Western Australia Open. Finished No. 100 on that circuit's Order of Merit.  
2012: Played primarily on the PGA Tour of Australasia, with a couple of appearances on the Asian Tour and five PGA TOUR Canada tournaments. Best performance of the season was a T5 in Canada, at the Times Colonist Island Savings Open. Shot rounds of 72-69-65-67 in June, tying with Scott Harrington, six shots behind winner Andrew Roque…In Australasia, his best showings were a T17 at the Victorian PGA Championship and a T26 at the New South Wales PGA Championship.  
2011: Played in seven combined PGA Tour of Australasia and Asian Tour events, missing the cut in all of them.  
2010: Made three combined starts on the PGA Tour of Australasia and the Japan Golf Tour.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour in 2016 is T38th at the Club Colombia Championship Presented by Claro.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T63rd in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Web.com Tour.
